poem:
**Pre-Market Reverie**

Shares leap—a fragile dance,  
regret whispered  
across digital seas.

Musk, a conductor  
in the market's symphony,  
tweets resounding  
through corridors of power.

Trump's shadow,  
a dusk of past words—  
now, a fickle grace.

In this exchange,  
a delicate weave—  
truth masked,  
yet hungry, as the ticker moves on.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Elon Musk says he ‘regrets’ some of his posts about Donald Trump; US-China trade framework cheers markets – business live 9.07am BST Tesla shares jump 2.5% in pre-market trading Shares in Tesla are set to rally in New York later today, after Elon Musk attempted to patch up relations with Donald Trump. Tesla’s shares are up 2.5% in premarket trading at $334.28, as traders react to Musk’s expression of regret over his criticism of Trump". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Elon Musk says he ‘regrets’ some of his posts about Donald Trump; US-China trade framework cheers markets – business live 9.07am BST Tesla shares jump 2.5% in pre-market trading Shares in Tesla are set to rally in New York later today, after Elon Musk attempted to patch up relations with Donald Trump. Tesla’s shares are up 2.5% in premarket trading at $334.28, as traders react to Musk’s expression of regret over his criticism of Trump
